metadata.feature_description: Show activity indicator icon for users with viewable activities

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Display activity icon for regular users

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Users via PersonaBar Manage menu
steps.expected: Users list should display with action icons for each user
steps.actual: Users list displayed with Content Editor and SuperUser Account rows visible with action icons

steps.action: Verify User Activity icon is visible for Content Editor (regular user)
steps.expected: User Activity icon should be displayed in the action icons column
steps.actual: User Activity icon (labeled 'User Activity' with title attribute) is visible for Content Editor user alongside Profile Settings, Account Settings, and User Roles icons

steps.action: Examine the SuperUser Account row in the Users list
steps.expected: User Activity icon should NOT be displayed for SuperUser
steps.actual: SuperUser Account row shows only 3 icons (Profile Settings, Account Settings, and menu) - NO User Activity icon is present. This matches code logic: showUserActivity returns false when user.isSuperUser is true

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify icon click opens activity tab

steps.action: Click on the User Activity icon for Content Editor user
steps.expected: User Activity details tab should expand showing activity information
steps.actual: Activity tab expanded successfully showing: Last Active (1 minute ago), Rank (2), Reputation (7), Experience (11), Engagement (0), Influence (0), Total Contributions (0), Edit Points button, and Recent Activity section with 'Joined Site 1 hour ago - EVOQ CONTENT LIBRARY'

observations: The SHOW_USER_ACTIVITY permission requirement is implemented in permissionHelpers.js - showUserActivity function checks (settings.isAdmin || settings.permissions.SHOW_USER_ACTIVITY). Since testing as SuperUser (admin), permission was granted.
Icon tooltip/hover state: The icon has a 'title' attribute set to the localized 'ShowUserActivity.title' value. Hover state visually highlights the icon.
The activity icon is implemented using SvgIcons.ActivityIcon from @dnnsoftware/dnn-react-common library.
